snippet: The leader of the R&A, which conducts the British Open, said the policy of men-only clubs was in no way comparable to racial or religious discrimination.
abstract: R&A chief executive Peter Dawson, who oversees the British Open, says the matter of men-only clubs will be reviewed but adds that the exclusionary policy is in no way comparable to racial or religious discrimination; site of 2013 championship, Murfield, is one of only three courses in the British Open rotation with a men-only membership policy.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the R&A, which conducts the British Open, said the policy of men-only clubs was in no way comparable to racial or religious discrimination.

headline.main: Member Policy of Men-Only Clubs Will Be Reviewed, R&A Official Says
headline.print_headline: Member Policy To Get Review, Official Says
